io.hekate.coordinate

Interface CoordinationHandler


  • public interface CoordinationHandler
    Handler for CoordinationProcess.

    Implementations of this interface are responsible for coordination logic within the CoordinationService and can be registered via CoordinationProcessConfig.setHandler(CoordinationHandler) method.

    Methods of this interface are called in the following order:

    • initialize() - gets called during the CoordinationService initialization
    • prepare(CoordinationContext) - gets called once per coordination round in order to prepare this handler
    • coordinate(CoordinationContext) - gets called only on the coordinator node in order start coordination
    • process(CoordinationRequest, CoordinationContext) gets called when a new request is received either from a coordinator or from some other member
    • cancel(CoordinationContext) - gets called if concurrent cluster topology change was detected and current coordination process should be cancelled
    • terminate() - gets called during the CoordinationService termination

    For more details and examples please see the documentation of CoordinationService interface.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void cancel(CoordinationContext ctx)
      Gets called if current coordination process should be cancelled.

    • Method Detail

      • prepare

        void prepare(CoordinationContext ctx)
        Signals the beginning of a new coordination process.

        Implementations of this method can perform initial preparations and initialize all necessary data structures for the new coordination process.

        Parameters:
        ctx - Coordination context.

      • coordinate

        void coordinate(CoordinationContext ctx)
        Gets called when local node is selected to be the coordinator.

        Implementations of this method should start executing coordination logic by communicating with other coordination memebers.

        Parameters:
        ctx - Coordination context.

      • process

        void process(CoordinationRequest request,
             CoordinationContext ctx)
        Gets called when a new request is received from a coordination member.

        Important!!! Each request must be explicitly replied via CoordinationRequest.reply(Object) method. Not replying to requests can lead to memory leaks since each coordination member keeps an in-memory structure to track sent requests and releases this memory only when requests get replied.

        Parameters:
        request - Request.
        ctx - Coordination context.

      • cancel

        default void cancel(CoordinationContext ctx)
        Gets called if current coordination process should be cancelled.

        Default implementation of this method is empty.

        Parameters:
        ctx - Coordination context.

      • initialize

        default void initialize()
        Gets called during the CoordinationService initialization.

        Default implementation of this method is empty.

      • terminate

        default void terminate()
        Gets called during the CoordinationService initialization.

        Default implementation of this method is empty.
